intro: Sonchella dentata, commonly known as the toothed sowthistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features alternate, toothed, and hairy leaves that are typically hairy and have a distinctive serrated edge. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, followed by fluffy white seeds. Sonchella dentata is often found in disturbed soils and can be considered a weed in agricultural settings.
